In India there is an enormous gap between healthcare supply and demand. What do you think are the major steps that can be taken by the government to improve patient care in the country?

I agree that there is an enormous gap between healthcare supply and demand in India,the following are the steps that can be taken by the government to improve patient care in the country.

                There are many lots of patients now-a-days existing in India.The government has to take primary steps to protect the Indians from such kind of problems by preparing certain policies and strategies. There should be proper healthcare provided to our country members in order to reduce the problems and to improve patient care. The proper supply of medicines and equipments that are needed to improve the present status of healthcare in India. There should be an adequate supply of medicines that are to be essentially supplied even to dispensaries.

                The government of India should provide to its citizens adequate and timely resources that are required. There is a huge responsibility of government in order to protect its citizens by providing proper services without fail. The government should plan for certain policies and strategies in order to increase the facilities requires and decrease the scarcity. The proper placement of jobs, that is recruiting doctors in order to increase the speed of service.

                There exists a wide gap between supply and demand in India. Hence government can also plan for certain policies like "AROGYA SHREE" plans in order to increase the efficiency of the service that is provided to patients in India. Government can also import certain medicines that are essentially required. The scarcity among supply of medicines or equipment can be reduced effectively.

                 The Indian country essentially need to move for a positive change in healthcare in order to provide better services to Indians. The proper utilization of strategies is required in order to reduce the gap between supply and demand. The implementation of the scheme "AROGYAMEY MAHABHAGYAM" and "SHIKSHA" has changed the environment of healthcare by continuous improvement for Indian citizens.

                 The proper utilization of the policies and strategies lead to improvement in the Indian country economy. The President of India is held responsible in implementing and creating strategies that are essentially required in order to improve the healthcare in India. The implementation of schemes regarding healthcare leads to great improvement in supply and demand of the essential resources. In today's fast growing technology new and improved equipment are made to increase the service in healthcare industry. There is requirement to adopt towards changing conditions in order to enhance the quality of healthcare.

Hence there is requirement to improve the supply and demand in healthcare which in turn increases the efficiency of the country towards healthcare and involvement of government is essential to enhance patient care in India
